image.altText: Arisa Trew smiles during women's park final in the skateboarding program at Paris Olympics.

props.synopsis: This was not a gold that was any better than the others Australia has won at the Olympics — but it was a timely reminder of the good that sport can bring.

title.children: In the beaming face of Arisa Trew, Australia is reminded that sport at its heart is a joyful addiction

image.altText: Kamala Harris standing at a podium with Tim Walz behind her.

props.synopsis: Democratic presidential candidate Kamala Harris says her vice-president pick Tim Walz "will be ready from day one" at rally in Philadelphia. Follow live.

title.children: Kamala Harris says campaign is a 'fight for the future' at first address with running mate Tim Walz

image.altText: A black-and-white photo of a runner with his coach.

props.synopsis: When running legend Herb Elliott won gold in 1960, he did so in a time that would have secured him a spot in the final at the Paris Olympics six decades later — and the sporting partnership that helped achieve that remarkable feat is now being celebrated on the silver screen.

title.children: Running uphill through sand, an eccentric visionary helped pave the path to gold

image.altText: A bottle of penfolds wine being poured.

props.synopsis: Ultra-premium wine collectors have snapped up a new commemorative bottle of Penfolds, but what is driving the hefty high price tags for luxury drops?

title.children: This $18,000 bottle of Australian wine sold out before it was released

image.altText: Matt Glaetzer

props.synopsis: Matt Glaetzer has had more Olympic Games near misses than anyone and his decade-long quest for a medal is a study in perseverance and Aussie grit.

title.children: 'Geez, I'm glad I stuck it out': Matt Glaetzer finally claims Olympic medal after 12 years of pain

image.altText: A smiling woman wearing a yellow top stands in front of a field of yellow flowers

props.synopsis: An Adelaide mother accused of attempting to murder her two young sons on a roadside was experiencing an episode of psychosis, characterised by delusional thoughts, at the time of the incident, a court hears.

title.children: Mum accused of stabbing young sons told police she was 'proud', court hears

image.altText: Anthony Albanese press conference__45ca69940707cdd3e542a6d38cc18b74

props.synopsis: Tuesday's Reserve Bank outcome looks to have curbed Anthony Albanese's scope for a visit to the governor-general before the end of the year.

title.children: Did the RBA just kill Albanese's early election?

image.altText: A large white dome that houses low-level radioactive waste.

props.synopsis: For decades, the issue of where to put Australia's nuclear waste has caused friction in regional communities and frustration for federal politicians on both sides. A possible solution has now emerged.

title.children: In WA's outback, a private company has managed to succeed where governments have not

image.altText: A train nearly hits a pedestrian.

props.synopsis: Footage of near-fatal incidents from across Adelaide's rail network has been released as transport authorities roll out a campaign urging pedestrians to be more cautious around trains and trams.

title.children: 'Confronting' videos of train and tram close calls released to highlight dangers of distraction

image.altText: Arisa Trew with her Olympic gold medal in Paris.

props.synopsis: At just 14 years of age, Arisa Trew shows cools nerves to win the women's park final and eclipse a milestone that has stood since the 1956 Melbourne Olympics, while Australia sets a world record in track cycling's team pursuit.

title.children: Skateboarder Arisa Trew becomes Australia's youngest gold medallist, while Aussie cyclists smash a world record

image.altText: A mother and child read a picture book while lying on a bed

props.synopsis: A Whyalla mother and first-time children's author hopes her book will break down the stigma around disability and help young families accept differences in the people around them.

title.children: Mum's picture book celebrates autistic son who 'climbs mountains' in his sleep

image.altText: A man in a suit smiles while unwrapping a burger

props.synopsis: Only a few weeks ago, many Americans outside Minnesota had never heard of Tim Walz. Now, he might be the country's next vice-president. Here's what to know about him.

title.children: He came up with the Democrats' favourite new insult against Trump. Now Walz is Harris's running mate

image.altText: A red dot north-east of Melbourne indicates the epicentre of an earthquake on a map.

props.synopsis: Seismologists believe the quake, which occurred north-east of Melbourne about 4am, is an "aftershock" from a larger earthquake which caused building damage in 2021.

title.children: Hundreds of Victorians feel impact of 4.1-magnitude earthquake near Melbourne

image.altText: women with her head in her hands looking stressed at her computer

props.synopsis: Many women don't realise perimenopause can begin as early as in their 30s, and that symptoms such as depression and "brain fog", can last for 10 to 15 years.

title.children: 'I thought I was way too young': Perimenopause is taking women by surprise

image.altText: Small fossil bone in palm of hand.

props.synopsis: The discovery of a 700,000-year-old arm bone fossil and two teeth on the Indonesian island of Flores is shedding light on how the tiny, now-extinct human Homo floresiensis evolved.

title.children: This tiny arm bone fossil sheds light on the early human species known as the 'hobbit'

image.altText: Tim Walz speaks in front of an American flag.

props.synopsis: Democratic presidential candidate Kamala Harris selects Minnesota Governor Tim Walz to be her running mate in the 2024 election.

title.children: Kamala Harris names Tim Walz as her vice-presidential running mate for 2024 US election

image.altText: A close up of Yahya Sinwa at a rally among a crowd of people.

props.synopsis: The announcement comes almost a week after Ismail Haniyeh was killed by a blast in Iran.

title.children: Hamas announces Yahya Sinwar as new leader after assassination of Ismail Haniyeh

image.altText: Frances Haugen portrait looks down the barrel of the camera

props.synopsis: Facebook whistleblower Frances Haugen smuggled out tens of thousands of documents that proved the tech giant knew the harms the platform caused to children. Years later she says Australia is at risk of fumbling an opportunity to regulate social media.

title.children: Will Australia blow its 'once-in-a-decade' chance to regulate social media?

image.altText: Department of Justice on a building with american flag behind.

props.synopsis: A Pakistani man with alleged ties to Iran has been charged in the United States in connection with a foiled plot to assassinate a US politician or government officials, the Department of Justice says.

title.children: US charges man with alleged ties to Iran in foiled assassination plot

image.altText: A man wearing glasses smiles.

props.synopsis: Nobel laureate Muhammad Yunus will head Bangladesh's interim government after former prime minister Sheikh Hasina stepped down and fled the country amid a mass uprising against her rule.

title.children: A Nobel laureate will head an interim government in Bangladesh after unrest ousted Hasina

image.altText: A man and woman, with their baby in a pram, looking at the ASX stock market boards in Sydney.

props.synopsis: The Australian share market is trading lower despite Wall Street rebounding after three days of sell-offs. Meanwhile, RBA officials have fronted the Senate's cost of living inquiry, a day after it left interest rates on hold. Follow live.

title.children: RBA officials grilled over cost-of-living crisis, Australian shares open lower after Wall Street rebound

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: ASX 200 opens lower despite boost on Wall Street
RBA 'can't set policy for one group'
Who is paying the price for slowing inflation?

image.altText: three kittens in a yard

props.synopsis: Animal rescue volunteers say the shock closure of the only RSPCA shelter on the Lower Eyre Peninsula will worsen Port Lincoln's abandoned cat problem.

title.children: City 'overrun' by abandoned cats to lose only RSPCA shelter

image.altText: Elon Musk

props.synopsis: A UK government minister criticised American tech billionaire Elon Musk on Tuesday for "unacceptable" comments on social media about the far-right riots gripping England and Northern Ireland.

title.children: 'Deeply irresponsible': UK justice minister slams Musk for comments about riots

image.altText: A woman stands by a sink in a bathroom.

props.synopsis: Jenna Lovell's hypermobile spectrum disorder means turning taps and handles can be impossible, but her landlord refused to replace the taps in her home. In Tasmania, she had no recourse other than an anti-discrimination complaint.

title.children: Jenna's landlord refused to make a $200 change so she could access water — until she sent a legal letter

image.altText: Michelle Bullock speaking in front of a wall covered in Reserve Bank of Australia logos.

props.synopsis: Despite what the Reserve Bank governor has said, many people expect interest rates will have to come down — possibly sooner than predicted.

title.children: Many think the RBA will have to cut rates well before inflation is where it wants it. Here's why

image.altText: Imane Khelif celebrates after winning a fight

props.synopsis: Imane Khelif is one win away from what she deems would be the "best response" to the worldwide gender controversy that has engulfed her Paris Olympics campaign.

title.children: 'Best response': Imane Khelif through to gold medal boxing bout amid gender controversy

image.altText: A composite of three gold medal winners. Left to right: Noemi fox, cam mcevoy and Saya Sakakibara

props.synopsis: Australia has to win a few more gold medals to beat any records this Olympic Games.

title.children: How well is Australia doing in the Paris 2024 Olympics?

image.altText: Hanah Green tees off during the second round of the Australian Open.

props.synopsis: Here's everything that's going to happen on day 12 of the Olympic Games.

title.children: Olympics schedule day 12: Hannah Green and Minjee Lee tee off and Matthew Denny's big throw

image.altText: a soldier with a blue scarf covering his mouth

props.synopsis: Experts say the apparent fall of the military command centre poses yet more serious questions about the military junta's capability and the future of its senior leadership.

title.children: 'Divorced from reality': How the fall of a key military post raises fresh questions about the Myanmar military's capability and leadership

image.altText: A doctor holds a stethoscope in two clasped hands

props.synopsis: Doctors over the age of 70 are more likely to receive a complaint, prompting the Australian medical board to propose regular health checks in order for them to continue working.

title.children: Spike in complaints against older doctors prompts call for regular health checks

image.altText: Australian diver Melissa Wu underwater after a dive at the Paris Olympics.

props.synopsis: Sydney teenager Ellie Cole finishes a superb seventh in the Olympic women's 10m platform final, four places ahead of her record-breaking hero Melissa Wu.

title.children: Aussie diving great Wu happy to pass torch to ‘inspiring’ teen teammate Cole

image.altText: A group of three Olympic medals - with silver, gold and bronze left to right - are shown against a dark background.

props.synopsis: Keep up with how many medals Aussie athletes have won today — and where Australia sits on the leaderboard.

title.children: Here's the medal standings after day 11 of the Olympic Games

image.altText: An Olympics official bends down to place a discus in the sun roof of an RC

props.synopsis: Those small cars darting across the background of track and field events have a big role behind the scenes. Here's what they do.

title.children: Have you spotted a mini car at the Olympics? They serve an important purpose

image.altText: A woman wearing a puffer jacket, green beanie and green backpack crouches in front of a smartphone on a tripod outside at night.

props.synopsis: Smartphones are now advanced enough to take photos that were once only possible using bulky cameras. Here's our guide to snapping a stunning shot of the Milky Way.

title.children: This photo of the Milky Way was shot with a phone — and you can do it too
